description.fr: Utilisez Sessions pour une revue forensic des connexions individuelles. Inspectez les details en profondeur avant de decider d'ignorer ou d'escalader.

visual.en: Detailed card showing full session information: DNS lookup results, TLS certificate details, ASN organization and country, geolocation, and process attribution (PID, process name, path, command line). Available on Linux via eBPF or netstat fallback.
visual.fr: Carte détaillée montrant les informations complètes de session : résultats DNS, détails du certificat TLS, ASN, géolocalisation et attribution de processus.

description.en: Use deep session details to confirm who connected, to what, and why before decisions.
description.fr: Utilisez les details de session approfondis pour confirmer qui se connecte, vers quoi et pourquoi avant decision.

title.fr: Ignorer – Marquer la Session comme Sûre

visual.en: Mark a flagged session as safe. Choose to dismiss by specific session, by port, or by process to create persistent dismissal rules. Dismissed sessions stop contributing to alerts. Undismiss anytime to restore monitoring.
visual.fr: Marquez une session signalée comme sûre. Choisissez de l'ignorer par session spécifique, par port ou par processus.

description.en: Dismiss only sessions positively verified as legitimate, and prefer narrow dismissal scope.
description.fr: Ignorez uniquement les sessions verifiees comme legitimes et privilegiez un perimetre d'ignorance etroit.

visual.en: The Processes tab displays network activity organized by application. A sortable table shows: Process (expandable with > arrow, showing app names like Safari, Mail, Notes, Terminal, Messages, Finder), User (the account running the process), # sessions (connection count), Throughput In (data rate received, e.g., 4.2KB/s, 770.9B/s), and Throughput Out (data rate sent, e.g., 1.8KB/s, 284.3B/s). Click the > arrow next to any process to expand and see its individual network sessions. This hierarchical view makes it easy to identify which applications are consuming bandwidth, detect unexpected network activity from apps that shouldn't be connecting to the internet, and monitor process-level traffic patterns for security analysis.
visual.fr: L'onglet Processus affiche l'activite reseau organisee par application. Un tableau triable montre le nom du processus, l'utilisateur, le nombre de sessions et le debit entrant/sortant. Developpez un processus pour voir ses sessions individuelles.

description.en: Use this view to baseline network behavior by application. Investigate processes with unusual volume or unexpected destinations.
description.fr: Utilisez cette vue pour etablir une base de comportement reseau par application. Analysez les processus avec volume inhabituel ou destinations inattendues.

visual.en: The Anomaly history tab displays a timeline of sessions flagged by the ML anomaly detection engine. At the top, filter buttons show 'Abnormal' (red, most severe) and 'Suspicious' (yellow, moderate), plus a search field for 'process, ASN, domain...'. A Status filter toggles between 'Active' and 'Dismissed' sessions. Each entry shows: a warning icon (triangle for Abnormal, shield for Suspicious), the process-to-destination flow in bold (e.g., 'tor -> evil-c2.darkweb.onion:443', 'iodine -> google-public-dns-a.google.com:53', 'netcat -> fake-paypal.net:8443', 'python3 -> trojan-dropper.evil.org:22'), protocol and port (TCP:443, UDP:53), status badges ('Abnormal' in red or 'Suspicious' in yellow), optional tags (like 'tor_exit_node'), and timestamp. This view surfaces potentially malicious activity detected by the Extended Isolation Forest algorithm for immediate investigation.
visual.fr: L'onglet Historique des anomalies affiche une chronologie des sessions signalees par le moteur de detection ML. Chaque entree montre le flux processus-destination, le protocole, les badges de statut et l'horodatage.

description.en: Use anomaly history as your investigation queue. Work recent abnormal events first and dismiss only with supporting evidence.
description.fr: Utilisez l'historique des anomalies comme file d'investigation. Traitez d'abord les evenements anormaux recents et ignorez uniquement avec des preuves.

visual.en: The Config tab provides system information and settings with four sub-views. Info displays Device ID, IP addresses (IPv4/IPv6), version, threat model date, and an elevation requirements table showing which privileges each threat needs for detection, remediation, and rollback. Notifications lets you toggle alerts per category (Score, Traffic, Network, Advisor, Policy, AI, Identity) and shows a scrollable notification history with timestamps and deep-links. Traffic (desktop-only) shows packet capture statistics, ML analyzer status with training metrics, detection thresholds, and session analysis counts. Debug provides a real-time log viewer with INFO/ERROR/WARN filters, search, and copy functionality for troubleshooting. The elevation table helps you understand which features require the EDAMAME Helper daemon.
visual.fr: L'onglet Config fournit les informations systeme et parametres avec quatre sous-vues : Info (details de l'appareil et table d'elevation), Notifications (bascules par categorie et historique), Traffic (statistiques de capture), et Debug (visualiseur de logs).

description.en: Use Config to verify runtime status, permissions, alerts, and diagnostics. Check helper/elevation readiness, tune notification noise, and consult debug tools when troubleshooting.
description.fr: Utilisez Config pour verifier l'etat d'execution, les permissions, les alertes et les diagnostics. Controlez la disponibilite helper/elevation, ajustez le bruit des notifications et consultez les outils de debug en cas de probleme.

title.fr: Info – Statut de l'Application et du Systeme

visual.en: The Info tab displays comprehensive system information. At the top, a description of EDAMAME Security's purpose, followed by: Device ID (unique identifier), IP addresses (IPv4 and IPv6), Version (e.g., '1.0.1 (Standalone)'), and Threat model version with date. Below, an explanation of the 5 elevation levels on macOS (user, global preferences, admin, system, full disk access). The main content is an elevation requirements table with columns: Threat (name of each security check), Capture (privilege needed to detect - 'user' or 'globalpreferences'), Remediation (privilege to fix - 'user', 'system', 'fulldisk'), Rollback (privilege to undo - 'user', 'system', 'fulldisk'), and Status (green/pink circle showing if currently achievable). This table helps you understand which threats require the EDAMAME Helper daemon or elevated permissions to remediate.
visual.fr: L'onglet Info affiche des informations systeme completes incluant l'ID de l'appareil, les adresses IP, la version et un tableau des exigences d'elevation montrant les privileges necessaires pour detecter, remedier et annuler chaque menace.

description.en: Use Info to confirm environment readiness before deeper troubleshooting. Check version/build metadata and privilege requirements.
description.fr: Utilisez Info pour confirmer la disponibilite de l'environnement avant un diagnostic approfondi. Verifiez les metadonnees version/build et les exigences de privilege.

visual.en: Sortable table showing each threat with its implementation, remediation, and rollback elevation requirements (user, admin, system). Color-coded by current privilege availability—shows which threats can be detected and remediated with your current permissions.
visual.fr: Tableau triable montrant chaque menace avec ses exigences d'élévation pour l'implémentation, la remédiation et le rollback.

description.en: Use this table to understand unavailable checks/fixes and grant only minimum required privileges.
description.fr: Utilisez ce tableau pour comprendre les controles/corrections indisponibles et n'accordez que les privileges minimaux requis.

title.fr: État de l'Agent – Helper et Permissions

visual.en: Shows EDAMAME Helper daemon status (running/stopped/version), admin privileges availability, full disk access status (macOS), and global preferences elevation. Guides you through enabling required permissions for full functionality.
visual.fr: Affiche le statut du démon EDAMAME Helper, la disponibilité des privilèges admin et le statut d'accès disque complet.

description.en: Check helper and permission state before deeper troubleshooting. Resolve prerequisites in order.
description.fr: Verifiez l'etat du helper et des permissions avant un depannage approfondi. Resolvez les pre-requis dans l'ordre.

visual.en: The Notifications tab is divided into two sections. 'Notification Settings' at the top shows a grid of toggle switches for each notification category: Score (security score changes), Traffic (anomalous sessions), Network (new LAN devices), General (rate limits), Advisor (todo updates), Policy (compliance changes), AI (agentic actions), and Identity (breach alerts). Toggle any switch to enable/disable notifications for that category - green means enabled. Below, 'Notification History' shows a scrollable timeline with a pink 'Clear' button to delete all entries. Each notification entry displays: a category icon (home for Advisor, star for Score, shield for Policy), the notification title and description (e.g., 'Security Advisor - 33 security issues detected +22 issues', 'Policy Status - Compliant with 3/4 policies', 'Security Score - Your score increased to 3.0'), and timestamp. Click any notification to navigate directly to its related content.
visual.fr: L'onglet Notifications est divise en deux sections. Les parametres en haut montrent des interrupteurs pour chaque categorie. L'historique en dessous affiche une chronologie cliquable des notifications passees.

description.en: Use this section to tune alert signal-to-noise for your workflow. Keep high-value categories enabled and review history regularly.
description.fr: Utilisez cette section pour ajuster le rapport signal/bruit des alertes selon votre flux de travail. Gardez actives les categories a forte valeur et consultez regulierement l'historique.

title.fr: Bascules par Catégorie – Contrôle par Type

visual.en: Toggle notifications on/off for each category: Score (security score changes), Session (anomalous/blacklisted traffic), LAN Scan (new devices), Advisor (todo updates), Policy (compliance changes), General (rate limits), Agentic (AI actions), Identity (credential breaches).
visual.fr: Activez/désactivez les notifications pour chaque catégorie : Score, Session, Scan LAN, Conseiller, Politique, Général, Agentique, Identité.

description.en: Enable actionable categories and reduce noise-heavy channels to keep alerts useful.
description.fr: Activez les categories actionnables et reduisez les canaux bruyants pour garder des alertes utiles.

visual.en: Scrollable history of all past notifications with timestamps and category icons. Click any notification to navigate directly to its related content (threat, session, device, breach, action). Persisted across app restarts.
visual.fr: Historique défilable de toutes les notifications passées avec horodatages et icônes de catégorie.

description.en: Use history to reconstruct incidents and reopen related content quickly.
description.fr: Utilisez l'historique pour reconstruire les incidents et rouvrir rapidement le contenu associe.

visual.en: The Traffic tab (desktop-only) displays detailed packet capture and ML analyzer statistics in a two-column layout. Left column 'Packet Statistics' shows Current Interval metrics (Total Processed, TCP, UDP, IPv4, IPv6, New Sessions, Updated Sessions) and Cumulative Totals with the same breakdowns showing lifetime counts (e.g., 14,504,160 total processed). A 'Last Update' timestamp appears at the bottom. Right column 'Analyzer Status' shows operational badges: 'Running' (green), 'Complete' (yellow), 'Trained' (green checkmark). 'Detection Thresholds' displays Suspicious Threshold (0.85), Abnormal Threshold (0.89), and percentile settings. 'Model Statistics' shows Buffer Usage (e.g., 472/800), Unique Samples, Feature Count (12 dimensions), and Downsample Factor. 'Score Distribution' displays min/mean/max values with P50/P90/P95/P99 percentiles. 'Session Analysis' summarizes Total Sessions with Normal (green) and Anomalous (red) counts.
visual.fr: L'onglet Trafic (bureau uniquement) affiche des statistiques detaillees de capture de paquets et de l'analyseur ML en deux colonnes. Les statistiques de paquets a gauche, le statut de l'analyseur et les metriques du modele a droite.

description.en: Use this diagnostics panel to monitor packet pipeline and analyzer health. Recheck thresholds and model stats when detection quality shifts.
description.fr: Utilisez ce panneau de diagnostic pour surveiller la pipeline de paquets et la sante de l'analyseur. Reverifiez les seuils et stats modele lorsque la qualite de detection evolue.

visual.en: The Debug tab provides a real-time log viewer for troubleshooting. At the top, a header shows the core version string (e.g., 'Core version is 1.0.1, built on 2026-01-28 with branch main on macOS 26.2 by flyonnet, memory usage: 0.0 MB'). Below, three filter buttons toggle log levels: 'INFO' (green), 'ERROR' (red), 'WARN' (yellow). A search field lets you filter log messages by text. The main area shows scrolling log output in a dark terminal-style view - though often empty during normal operation. A copy button (clipboard icon) on the right copies selected log content. This view is essential for diagnosing connection issues, API errors, or unexpected behavior when working with EDAMAME support. Log messages appear in real-time as the core engine processes security checks, network captures, and AI operations.
visual.fr: L'onglet Debug fournit un visualiseur de logs en temps reel pour le depannage. Des boutons de filtre basculent les niveaux INFO/ERROR/WARN. Un champ de recherche filtre les messages. Le bouton copier permet de partager les logs.

description.en: Use Debug logs for root-cause analysis with support or engineering. Filter by severity, search by keyword, and export relevant excerpts.
description.fr: Utilisez les logs Debug pour l'analyse de cause racine avec le support ou l'ingenierie. Filtrez par severite, recherchez par mot-cle et exportez les extraits pertinents.
